snippet: A federal complaint accuses the towns of Colorado City, Ariz., and Hildale, Utah, of discriminating against people who are not members of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.
abstract: Federal District Court in Arizona is set to hear case alleging  neighboring towns of Colorado City, Ariz, and Hildale, Utah, systematically discriminate against outsiders who are not part of Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints; federal government complaints allege towns and their institutions enforce laws of polygamous sect rather than those of United States.
lead_paragraph: A federal complaint accuses the towns of Colorado City, Ariz., and Hildale, Utah, of discriminating against people who are not members of the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

headline.main: Trial Explores Whether Towns Discriminate Against Nonmembers of Polygamous Sect
headline.print_headline: Towns on Trial in Complaints of Bias Against Sect Outsiders
